get.description:
Get the status of brand knowledge extraction (Phase 1: Progressive Brand Knowledge).

Returns the current status and progress of the brand's knowledge extraction workflow,
including whether quick extraction and deep crawl phases are complete.

This endpoint enables the frontend to:
- Show instant brand creation feedback
- Display real-time progress of knowledge extraction
- Determine when to enable features that require knowledge data
- Poll for updates during background processing

Phase Architecture:
- Phase 1 (Instant): Brand created in < 1 second with status "not_started"
- Phase 2 (Quick): Quick extraction adds colors/industry in < 3 seconds
- Phase 3 (Deep): Deep crawl runs in background (minutes to hours)
- Phase 4 (Enhancement): Campaigns improve as brand knowledge grows

RMM Level 2 Compliance:
- GET to /brands/{brand_id}/knowledge/status retrieves status resource
- Resource-oriented URL structure
- No verbs in URL path

Get real-time brand crawl progress (Issue #1279).

Returns comprehensive crawl status information so the frontend can show
users real-time progress during website crawling operations.

Status Values:
- not_started: No crawl has been initiated
- pending: Crawl queued but not yet started
- estimating: Analyzing website structure
- crawling: Actively crawling pages
- extracting: Extracting brand assets from crawled content
- uploading: Saving extracted assets
- complete: Crawl finished successfully
- failed: Crawl encountered an error

RMM Level 2 Compliance:
- GET retrieves crawl status sub-resource
- Resource-oriented hierarchical URL structure
- /crawl/status follows RMM-2 path pattern

    content_generation_publisher: Publisher for content generation requests

Returns:

SessionRequest.title: SessionRequest
SessionRequest.description:
Schema for unified session management (RMM L2 compliant).

For POST /api/v2/sessions endpoint.
Supports multiple grant types following OAuth2 patterns:
- grant_type: "password" - Login with email/password (default)
- grant_type: "refresh_token" - Refresh an existing session

RMM Level 2 Compliance:
- Single resource-based URL: /sessions
- HTTP method (POST) indicates create/update action
- Grant type in body differentiates login vs refresh
- No verbs in URL path

Examples:
    Login: {"grant_type": "password", "email": "user@example.com", "password": "secret"}
    Refresh: {"grant_type": "refresh_token", "refresh_token": "eyJ..."}

expiresIn.title: Expiresin

user.description: User profile (included for password grant, optional for refresh)

SessionResponse.title: SessionResponse
SessionResponse.description:
Unified session response for RMM L2 compliant sessions endpoint.

Used by POST /api/v2/sessions for both login and token refresh.
Contains all fields needed for both use cases.

For password grant (login):
- user: User profile data
- access_token: JWT access token
- refresh_token: Token for refreshing session
- token_type: Always "bearer"
- expires_in: Token expiration in seconds

For refresh_token grant:
- access_token: New JWT access token
- refresh_token: New refresh token
- token_type: Always "bearer"
- expires_in: Token expiration in seconds
- user: Optional (may be omitted for refresh)
